meanings.definition: The state of being under a curse.
meanings.sent1: The accursedness of the old castle filled the villagers with fear.
meanings.sent2: The accursedness of the witch's spell was finally broken by a brave hero.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the accursedness of the pretend curse they placed on their friend.
meanings.sent4: The accursedness of the haunted house seemed to seep into every corner, chilling all who entered.
meanings.sent5: The accursedness of the ancient artifact was said to bring misfortune to anyone who possessed it.

meanings.sent1: The accursedness of the dark forest was palpable in the air.
meanings.sent2: The accursedness of the pirate's treasure was rumored to bring doom to those who sought it.
meanings.sent3: Despite the accursedness of the situation, the brave knight stood firm in the face of danger.
meanings.sent4: The accursedness of the stormy sea mirrored the turmoil in the sailor's heart.
meanings.sent5: The accursedness of the forbidden mountain warned travelers to stay away from its treacherous paths.

meanings.definition: The condition of being cursed or damned.
meanings.sent1: The accursedness of the vampire's existence tormented him for centuries.
meanings.sent2: The accursedness of the ancient relic brought misfortune to all who possessed it.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the accursedness of Mondays, bringing laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The accursedness of the forbidden love affair led to tragedy for the star-crossed lovers.
meanings.sent5: The accursedness of the ghost's haunting left a chill in the air wherever it appeared.
